title: Petar Kurćubić
text:
Petar Kurćubić (; born 25 May 1961) is a <a href="Serbia">Serbia</a>n <a href="Association%20football">football</a> manager and former player.
Playing career.
Kurćubić played for <a href="FK%20Zemun">Zemun</a> in the <a href="1989%E2%80%9390%20Yugoslav%20Second%20League">1989–90 Yugoslav Second League</a>, helping the club win promotion to the <a href="Yugoslav%20First%20League">Yugoslav First League</a>.
Managerial career.
Kurćubić started his managerial career with <a href="FK%20Novi%20Sad">Novi Sad</a>. He was appointed as manager of <a href="FK%20Obili%C4%87">Obilić</a> in late December 1999. However, Kurćubić was replaced by Dragan Lacmanović in late January 2000 during preparations for the second part of <a href="1999%E2%80%932000%20First%20League%20of%20FR%20Yugoslavia">the season</a>.
Later on, Kurćubić served as manager of numerous clubs in his homeland and abroad, including Macedonian <a href="FK%20Pobeda">Pobeda</a> (2004–August 2005), Azerbaijani <a href="Olimpik%20Baku">Olimpik Baku</a> (October 2005–2006), <a href="FK%20Mladost%20Apatin">Mladost Apatin</a> (June 2006–June 2007), <a href="FK%20Banat%20Zrenjanin">Banat Zrenjanin</a> (June–October 2007), <a href="FK%20%C4%8CSK%20%C4%8Celarevo">ČSK Čelarevo</a> (two spells), Slovak <a href="FC%20Nitra">Nitra</a> (December 2008–June 2009), Slovak <a href="MFK%20Doln%C3%BD%20Kub%C3%ADn">Dolný Kubín</a> (2010–2011), <a href="FK%20Hajduk%20Kula">Hajduk Kula</a> (September–December 2011), <a href="FK%20Spartak%20Subotica">Spartak Subotica</a> (two spells; September 2012–October 2013 and June 2014–April 2015), <a href="FK%20Novi%20Pazar">Novi Pazar</a> (June–August 2015), Bosnian <a href="FK%20Borac%20Banja%20Luka">Borac Banja Luka</a> (September–October 2015), <a href="FK%20TSC%20Ba%C4%8Dka%20Topola">TSC Bačka Topola</a> (June–December 2017), and Bosnian <a href="FK%20Krupa">Krupa</a> (October 2018–March 2019).
